issues.description: The method acceptSupplyDelivery in the SealSaloon class is described in the problem statement as having four parameters (String, String, int, int), likely intended for supplier name, ingredient name, price, and quantity. However, in the solution repository, it is implemented with only three parameters (String, int, int), omitting the first String parameter. This discrepancy could confuse students who follow the problem statement, leading them to implement a version that doesn't match the provided solution structure, potentially causing errors when testing against expected outputs.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the solution repository to include the missing parameter in the acceptSupplyDelivery method to match the problem statement, for example, change it to public static void acceptSupplyDelivery(String supplierName, String ingredientName, int price, int quantity). If the parameter is not needed, revise the problem statement to align with the solution for consistency.

issues.description: The problem statement refers to ingredient names in lowercase (e.g., 'bacon'), while the solution code uses title case (e.g., 'Bacon'). This inconsistency in string representation for the same conceptual entities could confuse students, leading to errors in case-sensitive string comparisons and hindering their ability to map requirements to implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Standardize the casing of ingredient names across all artifacts to lowercase (e.g., 'bacon') to ensure consistent string matching and reduce cognitive load for students when implementing and testing their code.
